website_summaries.verdict: An affordable string that delivers a mellow, warm sound, although some claim that this isn't the most durable option.
pros: Available in a variety of gauges, from light and medium to rock & blues
Constructed of 80/20 wire wrapped around a tin-plated steel core wire
cons: Some complaints that these strings don't play well (too sharp and grippy) and break too easily

customer_reviews.title: The best acousric strings.
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing guitar for years, and these are the best sounding, longest lasting, and brightest Rings you can buy for the money. Seriously stock up on these. I do. Trust me, I'm a professional musician, and have been for many many years. If anyone knows about strings I do.
customer_reviews.author: Papa

customer_reviews.title: Got a bad string; no response from Ernie Ball customer service (UPDATED)
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy D'Addario but tried these because Ernie Ball offers slightly different gauges. Had a string break when I was putting it on the guitar and, since I've played for 30+ years, I'm pretty sure it wasn't operator error. Complained to Ernie Ball and got no response at all. I'll be using another brand in the future. UPDATE: Well, it took over a month to get a reply, but I got an e-mail from Ernie Ball yesterday saying they were sending a new set of strings. They're not timely but at least they responded appropriately, so my one-star review has been updated.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hipps

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these strings
customer_reviews.text: I’m a casual guitar player. I’m not good, I play in my living room for fun. I always put heavier strings on my cheap fender acoustic since I got it... I think I always believed I was too ham fisted to have light strings on it, and that I’d snap them during the first tuning. I wanted something meant for rock music and the only size available (during the time of my purchase) were medium-light I believe. I strung em up, and they look great and sound great. They play amazing, very durable and can get some great bends out of them. $5 for ErnieBall quality, what’s not to love.
customer_reviews.author: Rad AstronautTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great price for waht you get
customer_reviews.text: I unfortunately bought the wrong strings. I was looking to buy a set of 12 string guitar strings but I guess I clicked the wrong button and three sets of 6 strings were delivered. What the heck, I went ahead and tried these on a 1999 Taylor 315. They got a good sound. I don't know how long they'll last but for the price you can't go wrong.....well unless you meant to buy 12 string guitar strings then I guess you can go wrong. Happy playing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased a set of these as an experiment which, unfortunately, didn't work out for me.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking to change my d'Addario Phosphor Bronze 12s to 11s. Read a review where the player raved about these, so I gave 'em a try. Good enough sound, but very, very noisy when moving up and down the fingerboard. Every barre chord change makes a LOT of string noise and produced a huge spike on my home recording software. Probably pretty good for folky players who use a lot of Cowboy chords. No sweat, though, it was an experiment. At 5 bucks or so a pop for strings on Amazon, I'll be trying plenty more.
customer_reviews.author: Giskard Reventlov

customer_reviews.title: Fingers feel good!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these strings for a week now and they sound bright with a nice jazzy kick to each stroke. It's a huge improvement over the basic strings that came with my guitar without a doubt. More importantly the biggest plus for me is that my fingers don't hurt each time I play. I will update this review if the strings loose quality or break because apparently they don't do well over time.
customer_reviews.author: Narbeh Sarkissian

customer_reviews.title: These strings are brght.
customer_reviews.text: I am traditionally a bassist, getting more familiar with my acoustic so I have been trying out some new strings. That being said I find these strings to be uncomfortably bright and harsh. I was dubious by the "rock and blues" listing, and now I am not sure what that even means. I just don't hear any meat on these, they come across thing and metallic, in a way I am not used to.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Juliano

customer_reviews.title: Nice pack
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I am a brand new beginner guitar player. I broke a string on my guitar right after I got it while tuning it and these worked well as replacements. I bought the double set pack and it fits well in my guitar case so that I always have a spare now. It was easy to replace and the sound is great! Will buy these again in the future... but hopefully no time soon.
customer_reviews.author: collegestudent

customer_reviews.title: Low A broke within 45 minutes of re-string
customer_reviews.text: Tried these, but the low A broke within 45 minutes of practice playing on my 12 string acoustic just after re-string. It snapped over the saddle, something that I've never had for a low wirewound string. I've had the high G break near end of life, but never had a string go out when brand new. Compared to D'Addario Extra Lights I normally use, they are heavier gauge, the sound is bright and quite metallic, maybe a bit more body to the sound than the D'Addario's, and not bad in my opinion. But they are coming straight back off. Can't afford to risk a string going at the next gig. Back to the D'Addario strings for me.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Dull sounding at best
customer_reviews.text: I've put a lot of string on my acoustic and decided to try these. I bought a 3 pack. But after the first set, I'll be throwing the other 2 sets away. These don't sound bright at all. And if string don't sound bright, what good are they. If, on the other handle, you like strings that sound dull and are stiff, then these are perfect for you.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Keilhofer

customer_reviews.title: Just weird sounding...  They don't ever seem to break in neither
customer_reviews.text: These sounds exceedingly odd if you are using them like I did which is to replace a single string now she put them all on at once then I sound fine but you put this one on and it's got this weird Kinda sharp sound and I know their budget strings don't get me wrong they're not Top Flight but to me these are just about the worst sounding guitar strings I've ever had
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are my new goto string! Great, rich sound
customer_reviews.text: Currently deployed in Iraq. I bought a rather cheap acoustic guitar here to kill time, with some TLC, tuning, adjusting and these strings the guitar plays 10x better and sounds 100x better. These strings added a very rich, clean, but twangy kind of sound and it sounds so much better than I ever expected such a cheap guitar to sound. These strings are worth every penny. I’ve had them for a few months now, and no strings have broken and they hold tune as good as any other strings once broken in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, easy to install, actual metal feeling so unfortunately I can't really let my daughter play to put or it hurts her fingers, I got to find the other kind that are soft metal then plastic but for now at least she gets to play it and it makes her smile so much, she's only a few months old and is obsessed lol
customer_reviews.author: RidingMagee

customer_reviews.title: Strings are a bargain and look amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Strings look beautiful. They were super easy to install. Clearly labeled. I can't comment on the sound quality since I have no idea how to play my guitar, but they seem to be very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Smartest person alive

customer_reviews.title: Really unbalanced sound.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I thought these might work nice. I could always enjoy a better bass response, but there isn't a continuity to the strings as in the standard strings. To my ear it sounds very unbalanced between a nice bass and it makes the higher strings sound tinny. If you only play in the key of G, the G C D and Am sound great. For the key of E, E and B sound pretty good, but A is "iffy".Where the tone really goes astray is in an F chord - "yuck" D minor doesn't sound too good either.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Taylor Seagull

customer_reviews.title: Old Faithful
customer_reviews.text: My "go to" brand when I can't afford Elixirs some don't like EB but I personally prefer them over D'addario. I honestly can keep these on & not worry about changing them for 4-8 months. The tone gets a little more mellow than the brightness at the beginning of the string life. I recommend buying a pack.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Good strings - very light
customer_reviews.text: I got these so I could tune my 12-string up to pitch without too much pull on the neck. They work well. They are good sounding but very light. If I de-tune a whole step I get some buzzing on the frets just from the string slapping due to less tension. If you want to de-tune I suggest using the next guage up. Nice sounding though when tuned to pitch.
customer_reviews.author: WMan1234Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Burn wires
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you about sound quality or anything like that. I use them for burn wires on my wood lathe. For that purpose, they are fantastic. I use a small, a medium, and a large size wire for different size burn lines and I use them a lot. Daily. I'm still using my first set of wires. They haven't broken or burned through yet. That's almost a miracle. I'm very pleased and consider this one of my better purchases. I apologize if any guitarists are out there freaking out but burn wires are important too.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Very Tinny and... Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I thought these strings sounded terrible. Very tinny sounding - more metallic than warm and full. Maybe this is what Ernie Ball calls 'bright" but IMO they just sound bad. I gave them a few days hoping some time on the guitar would help, but I just can't take it anymore. I should have trusted other reviews that say similar things but I thought "how can they be that bad from a recognized brand like Ernie Ball?" Oh well...ordered another brand. EDIT: I put D'Addario strings on and the metallic, tinny sound is gone. Don't waste your money on these strings.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for bronze
customer_reviews.text: I put one set of these on my Taylor and the other on my ovation. They sound pretty good but I meant to order Ernie Ball’s silk and steel strings. I’ll keep these on my Taylor for a while but my ovation sounds so much cleaner with the silk & steel strings.
customer_reviews.author: Steve the Man

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The D string has a problem with tone quality and will not get in tune. The rest of the strings produce a buzzing sound and will go flat a few minutes into playing. Ernie Ball has made great electric strings for decades but I expected better than this for my first time buying Ernie Ball for my acoustic.
customer_reviews.author: DD85

customer_reviews.title: My favorite strings so far
customer_reviews.text: I have used either these or the D'Addario light strings for the small body acoustics I play and so far these are my favorite strings. They sound great and feel really nice and light, and for the price of a three pack of these it's well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Shriner

customer_reviews.title: G string broke during initial tuning
customer_reviews.text: This was the first time I've ever had a string break while tuning. The .010 G string for the 12 string broke before it ever made it to G. Other 11 seem fine, but I guess I'll be stuck playing my 6 string until I find a replacement because I only bought one set to try them.
customer_reviews.author: Emily R

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a cheap child sized guitar. Even at the reduced scale, they really have a great tone. With the much improved sound, my 9 year old has gone from just making noise to actually learning some basic chords and some basic fingerstyle songs.
customer_reviews.author: AtomicDad

customer_reviews.title: Basic strings
customer_reviews.text: Decent basic acoustic strings. Light & bright sound. Crisper sounding than phosphor. Perfect for a smaller acoustic - I have an Auditorium/000. Goes out of tune every other day & starts sounding kinda dull after 5 months of sporadic playing. But they’re cheap enough to replace.
customer_reviews.author: AKA AK

customer_reviews.title: Nice strings
customer_reviews.text: I'm a hobbyist guitarist so in all honesty I'm not married to any one brand or style guitar string, so these strings have been pretty good much like most. They have lasted a long time and stay in tune for about as long as I have expected.
customer_reviews.author: JNV

customer_reviews.title: bad string !!!
customer_reviews.text: After installing this set of strings on a Squier guitar, the sound is better. That is the good part. The bad thing is about quality control, the G string has one bad spot, please see photo, very hard to capture but easy to see with naked eye.
customer_reviews.author: KtnWin

customer_reviews.title: Really nice strings!
customer_reviews.text: Obviously strings can be a matter of preference, but I love these strings. I bought a travel guitar for 25 euro in Germany and replaced the strings to make a very serviceable travel rig. They feel great and sound better than one should expect from a $30 guitar. They have had an issue of durability. Even though I don't play every day, they are coming unwound around the second and 4th fret. The same thing has happened on two guitars.
customer_reviews.author: Jason E. Keller

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful sound. Nice light touch.
customer_reviews.text: Guitar sounds great with these strings. Great tone and resonance. I have broken 2 strings while tuning already.... I am pretty sure I didnt let my guitar adjust to the temperature change before trying to tune both times.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for bendable acoustic strings with tone, keep looking
customer_reviews.text: I just put these on my new Taylor 314CE. I am trying to find a good acoustic guitar string set that I can bend at least a half step and still maintain good guitar tone a la GNR Patience. I use Ernie Ball 10-52 slinky strings in my electrics, so decided to give these a try. What a big disappointment! This Earthwood set replaced an Elixir custom light 80/20 bronze set. Even my girlfriend immediately noticed. In her words: "Your guitar does not sing like it used to." Supposedly Slash uses "light" Ernie Ball acoustic strings. I don't know what gauge he uses, but these are definitely not it.
customer_reviews.author: Scarabei

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good
customer_reviews.text: I don't know much about guitar strings, my man bought these for an old acoustic guitar. He has been playing them and it sounds nice, falls out of tune easily but I think that happens with any new strings.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Missing a string... But the 11 others are good
customer_reviews.text: Great strings for 12 string guitar. Reason for four stars was this particular pack was missing the 14 gauge string. Kinda a bummer that I had to use my old one. But they sound good and first time I received a pack missing a string.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Stratemeyer

customer_reviews.title: high value for money
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace the strings on my acoustic guitar and I found this set here. Don't know if I can ask for anything better for the price. They looks fine and sounds good. I would buy them again if I'm not looking for anything in particular from the sound of my guitar
customer_reviews.author: Andrea P.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but GHS had to come to the rescue
customer_reviews.text: The strings sound great but the wound high "A" string broke on first tuning before it was even two steps below "A". I have had the high "G" string break on tuning but never an "A" string, so that was a big disappointment. I cannibalized a set of GHS Vintage Bronze Custom Lights, used a 20 gage...and viola...GHS to the rescue. These strings do sound exceptionally good (great harmonics too) so I am purchasing another set. Hopefully no breakage this time.
customer_reviews.author: tob-tob

customer_reviews.title: Great Strings
customer_reviews.text: These strings are fantastic. I love the sound of them and they feel great. I buy the Earthwood 80/20s and the phosphor bronze ones. I’ve never had a problem with either. Strings are really a personal choice so it depends on what you like. Give these a try and see how you like them.
customer_reviews.author: CookieDoughAvenger

customer_reviews.title: Best So Far
customer_reviews.text: Very nice sounds. I'm new with no clue. My fingers were hurting sliding on the low strings. Went down to these. Still hurts, not as bad but totally brought the life into my Guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Have played "Slinky's" on my electrics for years. Thought I'd try these on my acoustics to save some money. The sustain could be a little better, may go with the mediums next time. But so far I'm happy with the strings.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas R. Harwood

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite strings
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these strings. I've tried Martins and D'Addario on my acoustics. Thought I'd give these a go being they're more affordable. Turns out they're my favorite! Beautiful, bright tones. Easy on the fingers.
customer_reviews.author: tiffani hess

customer_reviews.title: These strings are blah!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not crazy about these strings. They don't have any sustain and they're not bright sounding at all but then again on another guitar they might be perfect. Who knows but for me I'm staying with D'Addario EJ16's. They seem to sound great on any guitar I put them on.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: My kid bought these strings and put them on her guitar (an old beater which was given to her), and I have to say that the strings actually sound and play pretty nicely even given how beat up the guitar is. I will likely give these a shot on my guitar when the time comes for me to get some more strings. Can't beat the value
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Quieter on the fretboard.
customer_reviews.text: Earthwood strings have become my favorite in acoustics. That is because they dont “squeak” like other brands when moving around the fretboard. That’s enough reason for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Worst guitar strings ever
customer_reviews.text: I had to order new guitar strings 3 days after playing on these. I ordered a different brand, of course. I noticed immediately that i couldn't get certain strings in tune at all. Ernie ball strings are horrible. They don't stay in tune and my G string sounds like a dying cat. This isn't my first bad experience with their strings. Usually they break very easily. Their straps are very nice though. I definitely recommend their straps.
customer_reviews.author: eric bonnell

customer_reviews.title: It's good to have an old friend back!
customer_reviews.text: I began using these strings in the late 60's because they ring better on, my guitars, than any other strings I have ever used! But due to contractual restrictions I had to stop using the for a long time. But it's nice to have available at Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: William Hammers

customer_reviews.title: Kind of waiting to see what happens..
customer_reviews.text: this is one of only two out of five sets of strings that did not eitehr break on installtion of sitting on a stand not being touched. Three out of five with defective strings of different brands all bought through amazon is NOT a good record
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Lovely
customer_reviews.text: I used these for a quilted wall hanging I made for a Christmas present. They worked beautifully for my eeds. As for their actual use I have no clue.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Anderson

customer_reviews.title: First time use n love em
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Ernie Ball since 1992. I love the sound n quality of the strings. I've played them all. 8's, 9's, 10's etc. First time use of Earthwood n traditional fashion They're Ernie's. Good sound softer to the touch than most acoustic strings. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Kalikid30

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced and great strings.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, there Ernie Balls. There my favorite strings. There isn't anything bad to say. A lot of people just use Ernie Balls for a reason. There one of the best sounding strings you can buy and made in the USA. They are priced reasonably on Amazon and I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Greene

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: Not as bright sound quality than my original Yamaha strings and this might be subjective to anybody. Built quality feels good though. Overall not bad for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Soulfly

customer_reviews.title: Super sound.
customer_reviews.text: Made my guitar sound brand new again. Great tone to that makes you play longer.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Mifflin

customer_reviews.title: Buy these!
customer_reviews.text: I often use Ernie Ball strings. They get the job done and sound pretty good. These are a nice variation for acoustic guitars. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Andrew DeCree

customer_reviews.title: Strings not the long wait.
customer_reviews.text: I waited well over a week for these strings, just to finally get them installed and the high E string to snap. When to Guitar Center to get 3 packs of Martin lower-gauge strings. I really love Ernie Ball strings, but these are so light in gauge that they belong on an electric. So in trying to avoid a long drive, I waited over a week to get these strings, then had to drive to GC anyways. Long-story-short, just buy a crap-load of strings all at once.
customer_reviews.author: Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I have used the medium before. Bought the lights for my nephew. Only thing was that the G-String snapped when tunning. Might have been defective. All other strings were fine.
customer_reviews.author: alqsanc

customer_reviews.title: This is a set of guitar strings.
customer_reviews.text: This is a set of guitar strings which I purchased as a spare set to keep in my guitar case. I'll be able to answer your questions if/when I make use of one or more of the strings.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia  N. Blatt

customer_reviews.title: Teriffic strings!!
customer_reviews.text: I buy Ernie Balls electric guitar strings for my Jazzmaster guitar, and I'm very happy with them. What can I say? Earthwood Rock and Blues are terrific!! Great clear sound and warm where they should be. You can't go wrong with any Ernie Ball strings!!
customer_reviews.author: chris leary

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Responsive
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my Ovation and they're very bright. I like something a bit easier to bend and shape thats kinder on the neck in the long run too.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Carbo

customer_reviews.title: Used?
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it was a use small E string but, the string looks like it was used and it was too short, like it was cut. Disappointed for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: great value so far
customer_reviews.text: Can't say anything about the longevity since I just put them on. But they do sound nice and feel better compared to the old strings. I did make a few other little changes to the guitar they're on that overall make it sound much better.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J.

customer_reviews.title: Bright and deep sounding all in one!
customer_reviews.text: They have a bright sound as well as a deeper tone.
customer_reviews.author: HardwiredMike

customer_reviews.title: D string snapped way too early
customer_reviews.text: They're nice strings but kinda flimsy. During restringing, the D string snapped as soon as I tried to tighten it a bit - it didn't even make it one loop around the tuning peg! Well, it was really cheap, so that's that I guess. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: zsolt

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly balance bright string. Low end just as vibrant as high end making a beautiful bright and warm sound. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cayton-Katie Herzberg

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to read string gauge before ordering!
customer_reviews.text: Get three sets for the price of what I normally pay for one! Sure, I'll bite. I gave these a shot because of the high rating and the low price. 30+ year player here. I put them on my $5000 custom Taylor and, it sounded like a toy I'd pickup in Walmart. Very disappointed. But, as the saying goes, "You get what you pay for."
customer_reviews.author: One-Man-Bandit

customer_reviews.title: Good Strings
customer_reviews.text: Put them on my acoustic and they sound great... been about a month and I play it a few times a week. So far so good. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nels

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a cheap guitar and they turned out to be surprisingly nice sounding. Slightly lighter gauge than normal light, which was what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: OfficeBoy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Strings.
customer_reviews.text: These are the only strings I use, and have used for about 6-7 years now I think? Probably more. Anyway, they’re amazing and I wouldn’t have anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Divina

customer_reviews.title: These are really good strings on most 12 string guitars
customer_reviews.text: These are really good strings on most 12 string guitars. As each guitar is different with voicing, materials, design, and age it is impossible to say they work great on all 12 strings but they hit the mark on most I have worked on. Great balance across the tonal range.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. AdamsTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Love them, been using these over a year!
customer_reviews.text: Great balanced tone! Sounds very nice when fresh. Even sounds nice for a mellow vibe when the strings get old.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I always use these over elixer
customer_reviews.text: My favorite set, but need to be changed after heavy usage. But i think elixers sound worse in my opinion after time so these are cheaper and better for my playing time
customer_reviews.author: Shayna

customer_reviews.title: The string broke right away
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have a chance to try these strings in a chords because, unfortunately, the thinnest string broke right away. One by one they sound very bright, even too bright to my liking.
customer_reviews.author: T.D.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound
customer_reviews.text: Really good sounding strings I bought a used Takamine and the sound was incredible I has to find out what strings were used by the owner told me about one he used and it did not match these strings so I had to get back with him and he told me about these. They sound great
customer_reviews.author: W. Currie

customer_reviews.title: Love love love the tone
customer_reviews.text: The tone from these brought an entirely new life to my acoustic that I didn’t think was possible. Very versatile sound.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great step up strings
customer_reviews.text: I've always played on light gauge strings and really wanted more sound out of my guitar so I found these and just took a gamble on this medium/light set and I was not disappointed. There was an immediate notice in sound difference and also the playablility of my guitar became a little more challenging. They offer a very warm tone with very good balance overall throughout the strings. I've always liked Ernie Ball strings and these were a great starter set for me to upgrade to. Would recommend to any level of guitar player!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Butts

customer_reviews.title: Can never go wrong with Ernie Balls!
customer_reviews.text: Nice strings for a childs acoustic guitar. Very good feel, nice and slinky, and wicked cool brass color to them that I just love looking at as I play. A visual, tactile, and auditory pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: judd

customer_reviews.title: Great strings
customer_reviews.text: Strings work exactly as they should. Easy to work with, my husband's guitar sounds amazing again
customer_reviews.author: ItsAllAMile

customer_reviews.title: Always a pleasure
customer_reviews.text: Never disappointed with Ernie Balls. Great strings, as always. Nice bright, pleasant tone on my Martin Backpacker.
customer_reviews.author: Reagen

customer_reviews.title: Great clean tone
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pack of EB's, and i love the tone but my g string breaks pretty consistently after about a month of playing, about an hour a day. All of the other strings seem to have 5 times the life of the G, but it could be user error. Other then that its a great value, and i would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Sarich

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. The tone doesn't last as long as some other strings but the price is worth it
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: cheap and good
customer_reviews.text: i need a new set of strings that won't break my purse and these, they come together and the spund they made was wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Leong

customer_reviews.title: Steve Wilson Of Porcupine Tree Used These On Tour
customer_reviews.text: On the 'Fear Of A Blank Planet Tour' I stood at Stage Front and the instrument technician was stringing Steve Wilson of Porcupine Tree acoustic guitars. I asked him what strings does Steve use. He showed me the wrappers and these are the ones. I guess if they're good enough for Porcupine Tree live sound, they are good enough for me. Be sure to wipe-off loose metallic splinters before using them. They ouch the nerve endings in your fingers.Especially the ones from Just Strings.
customer_reviews.author: WildOat

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding strings
customer_reviews.text: I have played GHS and D'Addario strings most of my playing life...they are also great strings but about a year ago I tried the Earthwood 80/20s. I now have them on several of my acoustics and am very happy with the sound on all. The thing I particulary like about the Light gauge is the 11 on the high E....most string makers have 12 on the high E and it is too heavy for my taste. The 11-52 range is ideal for my playing style and delivers a very balanced sound. The strings hold a great sustain and also seem to stay crisp and clean sounding for a long time. All in all a great string.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle White

customer_reviews.title: Happy with these strings
customer_reviews.text: Happy with these strings. Have been using them for about three weeks with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Robt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Acoustic Strings
customer_reviews.text: The strings produce a beautiful, crisp, earthy tone. It is a full sound with a perfect balance of low, mid and high. These strings will be the only strings I put on my acoustic guitar for the foreseeable future!
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: The Best, I Said!
customer_reviews.text: These strings changed my life! the first time I put them on my cheap acoustic was the first time I ever really loved an acoustic guitar! The only acoustic strings I ever want to use.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Resin

customer_reviews.title: my new favorite strings
customer_reviews.text: i've tried many acoustic strings so far but these are by far my favorite. they feel nice to the touch when playing and have a wonderful sound.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: G String broke while restringing...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been playing guitar for 13 years and these are the first strings I’ve ever had break while simply tuning up for the first time. G string snapped right away. I’ve always used Ernie Ball strings and have never had an issue until now so hopefully I just got a bad pack. Sure won’t be buying these specific ones again though.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Waller

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Sound!
customer_reviews.text: Great strings! Sound amazing, practically just as good as my Elixer Nanowebs I used before this. And for how cheap they are?! I don’t think I’ll be buying much of anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: A bit on the heavy side for my Yamaha FG 820. After two days, they started to keep tune. They really stretched out prior to that.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Strong broke right away.
customer_reviews.text: The "A" String unravelled right away while tuning it. I did not overtighten. I know how to string guitars.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my guitar that I goof around with. wil buy again when needed
customer_reviews.author: Kibe

customer_reviews.title: Great strings, great price
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome on my 12 string — I won’t buy anything r,we from no on!
customer_reviews.author: life-long learner

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: These strings are individually labeled which was much easier for us to restring our guitar
customer_reviews.author: Libbys amazon

customer_reviews.title: Nice Strings
customer_reviews.text: I like these strings, my acoustic guitar plays and sound great with these strings
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Very Tin-like sound.
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst strings I have ever purchased. Played a set and threw them out. If you are new to 12 string they don’t even pair them or mark them out. They sound like crap. Tiny and crappy.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great warm sounding strings
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to strings for my acoustic guitar. They sound warm and aren't too bright which is one thing I didn't care for with phosphor bronze strings. It's a personal decision, but I really enjoy these strings.
customer_reviews.author: Brppratt

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. The Ernie Ball standard holds true.
customer_reviews.text: These strings have a really bright sound. I'm mostly an electric guitar player but every once in awhile I jam on an old Seagull. These strings really gave it some new life. I've always been a fan of Ernie Ball and use the SkinnyTops HeavyBottoms and these are comparable in quality. I've also never popped an Ernie Ball strong while playing. These hold to that standard.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Weak strength?
customer_reviews.text: The .12 E string broke as I was stringing my guitar. I've been using Ernie Ball strings for years and I've never had that happen. First time I've used their acoustic strings though. Just very disappointed. Having to put an old string back on is just very crappy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are just the right shade of bright with the perfect string tension response for my fingerpicking style
customer_reviews.text: I've settled on these Earthwood Mediums for my LA Guitars custom Martin OM-15. They are just the right shade of bright with the perfect string tension response for my fingerpicking style. The treble and bass frequencies are perfectly balanced (to my ears). I'll report back on life span.
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN HUMMEL

customer_reviews.title: Great Strings
customer_reviews.text: Love these strings for acoustic. Great for beginners and amateur. Great price, too.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Nana

customer_reviews.title: Sweetest Sound Ever
customer_reviews.text: Sweetest Sound Ever - I used Dean Markley Light Gauge before - but these strings have the sweetest sound ever.
customer_reviews.author: VickieRoks

customer_reviews.title: Good value great sound
customer_reviews.text: Dollar for dollar some of the best string you can purchase without breaking the bank. I have been using them for several years.
customer_reviews.author: J. King

customer_reviews.title: Nice mellow sound, but high tension
customer_reviews.text: Ernie Ball Earthwood 80/20 Bronze Medium (13-56) strings have a full and nice mellow sound that I really like. Unfortunately, as heavy gauge strings they require a lot of tension to tune up. I am used to light and extra light strings, so I have tuned these 2 half notes low, (i.e. E string tuned to D, etc.) to reduce tension, but they are still hard on the fingers to play. I will look for a lighter version of the Earthwood strings, to try to get the same full yet mellow sound without the high string tension.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B

product_meta.title: Ernie Ball Earthwood Light 80/20 Bronze Acoustic Set, .011 - .052
product_meta.description: Size:Light| Style:Single PackMade from 80% copper, 20% zinc wire wrapped around hex shaped tin plated high carbon steel core wire. One of the most popular acoustic guitar strings as used by the Eagles, Elvis Costello and Joe Bonamassa. Ernie Ball 80/20 bronze acoustic strings provide a crisp, bright sound with pleasing overtones. Gauges .011, .015, .022w, .030, .042, .052. Part number 2004
feature_bullets: Wound Strings are 80% copper, 20% zinc wire wrapped around hex shaped tin plated steel core wire
Plain strings are made of specially tempered tin plated high carbon steel
The most popular acoustic guitar string alloy provides well balanced projection with crisp pleasing highs
Element Shield Packaging Prolongs string life and keeps strings as fresh as the day they were made
Made in California, U.S.A. Featuring the finest and freshest materials.
